title.narrative: DEC Ukraine Humanitarian Appeal DePaul International

description.narrative:
Primary implementation will be carried out by Depaul Ukraine who have offices across the country: Kharkiv, Kyiv, Odesa and Mukachevo. DP will develop an appropriate staffing model and build its capacity in core areas. This includes new dedicated operational teams in Bratislava and Mukachevo, west Ukraine. DP will initially target delivery on the ground through our in-situ staff teams, especially those in Kharkiv and Odesa, and then expand. The programme will utilise and build on Depaul’s existing expertise and reach in Ukraine. We will also develop partnerships within the Catholic Vincentian network which has reach into other communities across Ukraine. The network reaches across Lviv, Dnipro, Zaporizhzhia and Mykolayiv regions.
Six principles guiding the programme are adaptiveness, targeting, cross-border collaboration, preparedness, safeguarding children and vulnerable adults and security.
Programme objectives: A. Affected populations have access to food assistance (scale up purchasing of food and refining logistics to distribute supplies to soup kitchens, outreach to home of vulnerable people and families and distribution points run by DePaul staff and vols. B. Affected populations have access to vital social services. 75 individuals to recieve permanent shelter or supported accomodation for six months. Welfare checks for vulnerable adults and families. Supported accomodation for homeless single monthers and their children. (Project now moved from Kharkiv to a safer location in West). Also operate orphanage for children with complex disabilities in Ivano-Frankivsk region. C. Affected populations have access to medicine and hygiene products. D. Capacity strengthening of local staff in humanitarian response (including security, safeguarding, humanitarian standards, programme quality and implementation, logistics and procurement) E. Trauma-informed approaches improved
